newsitem.title: USA: Koss says outlook remains positive.
newsitem.headline: Koss says outlook remains positive.

text.p: Koss Corp, a maker of high fidelity stereophones, said it was still expecting the first six months of its upcoming fiscal year 1998, beginning in July, to be positive.
But president Michael Koss said the company was monitoring developments at retail following recent steps to tighten credit by the Federal Reserve.

"In recent years, higher interest rates have constricted retail inventories," Koss said in a statement. "We have not experienced any reductions in the order cycle at this time, but we are mindful of its potential effect on next year's business."
Earlier Wednesday, Koss reported third-quarter earnings rose to $0.15 per share from $0.06 a year ago.

"Our year-to-date earnings performance exceeds that of any full fiscal year in our company's history. We are looking forward to the completion of fiscal 1997 in June as our second year of 'back to back' record breakers," Koss said.
